content: the last row worked over top to line up with the beginning chain row see photos #1 & #2 seaming chain 1 insert the crochet hook through the 1st st of both edges yo pull through both sts and the loop on your hook creating a slip_stitch see photo #3 continue slip stitching along the edge fasten_off creating a knot to secure the seam stitches 45 sts this is the ws wrong side of your hat tube using a darning needle and the 18 tail that you left before creating the beginning chain weave the yarn through the stitches around the opening of the tube gently pull the yarn cinching the top closed tie a sturdy knot but do not cut excess yarn push the yarn through the top hole to the rs right side and turn the hat right side out you will now weave the excess yarn around the hole that is left at the top to seam it closed see photos #4 #5 & #6 fo fasten_off and weave in the excess end before trimming roll up the bottom opening to create the brim of the hat see photo #7 you can choose to add a pom pom if you wish i have used a faux fur pom to top off mine photos 1 2 3 4 5 kirshner mountain toque ©nicole kliner designs aka tied up in knots designs december 2022 all rights reserved 4 | p a ge 6 7 there you have it you have made your very own #kirshnermountaintoque i d love to see your finished items so please feel free to tag me @www instagram com/tiedupinknots designs orwww facebook com/tiedupinknotscanadian when you are posting your photos so i can admire your work the photographs and pattern contained in this document are the sole property of ©nicole kliner designs aka tied up in knots designs you may not reproduce redistribute or share this pattern you may sell your finished items but please give credit to myself as the designer special thanks to these lovely testers katie penley wrenn michelle taylor wilson kirshner mountain toque ©nicole kliner designs aka tied up in knots designs december 2022 all rights reserved
